TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MembershipCreateUserException extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a user is not successfully created by a membership provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown when a <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> operation fails.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980(v=vs.100)) before continuing. For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd).
The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property indicates the reason for the exception so you can handle it appropriately.
## Examples The following code example creates a new user for an ASP.NET application configured to use forms authentication and ASP.NET membership. If the user is not created successfully, the code catches the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> and displays the message specified in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This example contains a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07).

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method when the user is not created.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException/CS/createuser3cs.aspx#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException/VB/createuser3vb.aspx#3)]

Docs.param: A description of the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the property to the supplied parameter value

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method when the user is not created.
You can use the `message` parameter to set the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the exception to a meaningful description of the reason for the exception.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown with a message based on the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException/CS/createuser2cs.aspx#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException/VB/createuser2vb.aspx#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus statusCode) cil managed

Docs.param: A enumeration value that describes the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method when the user is not created.
The `statusCode` parameter enables you to indicate why the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> was thrown. The `statusCode` parameter value is exposed by the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown with the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method when the user is not created.
You can use this overload of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> constructor to supply information regarding a caught exception that occurred while the user was being created.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown. If the exception is not a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException>, the caught exception is supplied as the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> that is thrown.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException/CS/createuser4cs.aspx#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException/VB/createuser4vb.aspx#4)]

remarks.format:

## Examples The following code example creates a new user for an ASP.NET application configured to use forms authentication and ASP.NET membership. If the user is not created successfully, the code catches the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> and displays the message specified in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property.
